intro: Leptosyne calliopsidea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
